snippet: The Democratic mayoral candidate William C. Thompson Jr. said that it was time for Raymond W. Kelly, the popular police commissioner, to “make a decision.”
abstract: Speculation that New York City Police Commissioner Raymond W Kelly will seek a mayoral bid is intensifying as area Republicans urge him to run; Democratic candidate William C Thompson Jr says it is time for the commissioner to make a decision, as political talk is distracting him from fighting crime. (M)y
lead_paragraph: In New York City political circles, it is the question that will not go away: Will Raymond W. Kelly, the popular police commissioner, throw his blue cap into the ring and run for mayor? Rumors of his candidacy have circulated in the tabloids for weeks. Top city Republicans, who still lack a prominent candidate for City Hall, are salivating over the prospect. And no one seems cowed by Mr. Kelly's self-professed lack of interest.

headline.main: Will Kelly Run for Mayor? One Candidate Tires of Talk
